metadata.description: Cabinetmakers, also known as Joiners, are creative builders who turn natural materials into finished products. They enjoy working with others to develop beautiful and functional furnishings.

markdown:
Skip to main content

![person measuring wood with measuring tape and pencil](/sites/default/files/2023-02/cabinetmaker%20construction%20trade.jpg)

As a Cabinetmaker, you’ll draw on your math skills and creativity to develop products that are not only functional, but also reflect your signature style. You’ll enjoy the physical challenge of working with wood and becoming deeply familiar with the different materials and tools at your disposal. 

You might find yourself in a workshop alongside other Cabinetmakers, or on a construction site.

#### What You'll Learn

  * How to interpret architectural drawings 
  * How to use woodworking machines and hand tools 
  * How to build, repair and re-style wooden furniture, cabinets, and fixtures 
  * How to sand surfaces and apply veneer and stain 
  * How to calculate dimensions and estimate materials and costs 



#### Key Job Skills

  * Active listening and monitoring
  * Operating woodworking machines and hand tools
  * Product assembly and construction
  * Preparing cost estimates
  * Finish application 



#### Technical Training

To get certified, you will need to sign up for technical training at an approved training provider in addition to on-the-job training. 

Visit [Trades Training BC](https://www.tradestrainingbc.ca/) and [EducationPlannerBC](https://educationplannerbc.ca/search) for a comprehensive list of what programs are available in your trade at public and non-public schools. 

Technical Training 24 weeks over 4 years 

Work-Based Training

6480 HOURS

General Skills

[Athletic](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAthletic) [Collaborative](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ACollaborative) [Mathematical](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AMathematical) [Precise](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3APrecise) [Tactile](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ATactile)

## 

Harmonized Program Information and Resources

In effect starting September 1, 2023

#### [Program Profile Occupational Description Cabinetmakers, also known as Joiners, build, repair and re-style wooden furniture, cabinets, fixtures and other products. They use architectural drawings, and they often operate woodworking machines to cut and form parts, which they then assemble into finished products. Preparation of cost estimates is often a key skill and responsibility for Cabinetmakers. Some specialize in custom-made furniture, while many work in the construction industry. Increasingly, Cabinetmakers are tasked with installing pre-manufactured cabinets and fixtures.  View PDF](/media/2070/download)

#### [Program Outline Guidelines for delivery of technical training at SkilledTradesBC Recognized Training Providers View PDF](/media/1871/download) #### [Record Book An easy-to-use tool to help you identify your trades training needs, track your progress, and move towards certification.  View PDF](/media/2080/download)

## 

Challenge the Trade

If you have significant work experience in a trade but have never been certified in Canada, you may apply to challenge the certification. Learn more about [How to Challenge a Skilled Trade](/challenge-skilled-trade).

OR

If you sponsor apprentices but have never been certified in Canada, you may request to supervise and sign-off apprentices when they are ready to be certified. Please [contact customer service](/contact-us) for more information.

#### [Instructions How to Apply View](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/instructions-challenge-certification) #### [Online Application Sign up for the Portal to start your online application Start Application](https://portal.skilledtradesbc.ca/Account/Login/Register?registrationType=certified) #### [Employer Declaration Document of relevant work experience View PDF](/media/2081/download) #### [Statutory Declaration Attestation for self-employment/work experience when employer cannot be contacted View PDF](/media/2082/download)
